camera.name: Kodak EasyShare C1013
camera.description: 10.3 million effective pixels; 36 MP/cm^2 pixel density; 34 mm - 102 mm (3x) zoom lens;
camera.summary: An uninspiring camera that struggles to produce anything but uninspiring results, it's hard to see how you would recommend the C1013 over similarly priced competitors that offer better styling and more reliable results. Kodak is capable of making great budget cameras, but unfortunately the C1013 simply isn't one of them. At its best, in the right conditions, the C1013 can produce appealing photos, but it's frustrating to use and is far too likely to mess up the exposure or color to be considered a reliable point and shoot camera. Our advice? Steer clear.

camera.name: Kodak EasyShare Z1285
camera.description: 12.1 million effective pixels; 29 MP/cm^2 pixel density; 35 mm - 175 mm (5x) zoom lens;
camera.summary: Mid-sized 12 megapixel compact with a 5x zoom that's marginally cheaper than sister model the Z1085is, but the pointless extra megapixels are no compensation for the loss of optical image stabilization and reduced manual controls. Decent enough feature set but there are more appealing models in Kodak's range - and elsewhere.

camera.name: Kodak EasyShare M1033
camera.description: 10.1 million effective pixels; 35 MP/cm^2 pixel density; 35 mm - 105 mm (3x) zoom lens;
camera.summary: Small and stylish (something Kodak is finally mastering) 10 megapixel compact that offers 720p30 HD movie capture (MPEG-4), large wide-view 3" screen and a range of color options. The 3x zoom is nothing to write home about but at least it covers a useful 35-105mm range and the overall feature set is pretty comprehensive for a camera at this price point. One of a range of confusingly similar EasyShare 'M' models that offer minor design and feature variations.

camera.name: Kodak EasyShare M893 IS
camera.description: 8.1 million effective pixels; 33 MP/cm^2 pixel density; 34 mm - 102 mm (3x) zoom lens;
camera.summary: Simple budget compact with Kodak's signature ease of use and relatively slim, stylish design. Decent feature set for a camera at this level and range of color options - plus optical image stabilization. One of a range of confusingly similar EasyShare 'M' models that offer minor design and feature variations.

camera.name: Kodak EasyShare M863
camera.description: 8.2 million effective pixels; 33 MP/cm^2 pixel density; 34 mm - 102 mm (3x) zoom lens;
camera.summary: Basic budget compact with Kodak's signature ease of use and relatively slim, stylish design. Decent feature set for a camera at this level and range of color options. One of a range of confusingly similar EasyShare 'M' models that offer minor design and feature variations.

camera.name: Kodak EasyShare M763
camera.description: 7.2 million effective pixels; 29 MP/cm^2 pixel density; 34 mm - 102 mm (3x) zoom lens;
camera.summary: Basic budget compact with Kodak's signature ease of use and relatively slim, stylish design. Decent feature set for a camera at this level and range of color options. One of a range of confusingly similar EasyShare 'M' models that offer minor design and feature variations.

camera.name: Kodak EasyShare Z1085 IS
camera.description: 10.0 million effective pixels; 21 MP/cm^2 pixel density; 35 mm - 175 mm (5x) zoom lens;
camera.summary: Mid-sized 12 megapixel compact with a 5x zoom and optical image stabilization. 720p30 high definition movie capture and a full range of manual exposure controls broaden the appeal, but our experience of Kodak's image quality in the Z range is that they only really perform in good light at the lowest ISO settings.

camera.name: Kodak EasyShare V1273
camera.description: 12.0 million effective pixels; 29 MP/cm^2 pixel density; 37 mm - 111 mm (3x) zoom lens;
camera.summary: Kodak's premium V series compacts offer large high resolution touch-screen displays, image stabilization and lots of funky features (though the 3x zoom has no real wide angle). The V1073 and V1273 (which adds a couple more megapixels) are good value for the gadget lover looking for a feature-rich pocket-sized camera.

camera.name: Kodak EasyShare V1073
camera.description: 11.1 million effective pixels; 24 MP/cm^2 pixel density; 37 mm - 111 mm (3x) zoom lens;
camera.summary: Kodak's premium V series compacts offer large high resolution touch-screen displays, image stabilization and lots of funky features (though the 3x zoom has no real wide angle). The V1073 and V1273 (which adds a couple more megapixels) are good value for the gadget lover looking for a feature-rich pocket-sized camera.

camera.name: Kodak EasyShare Z8612 IS
camera.description: 8.1 million effective pixels; 33 MP/cm^2 pixel density; 36 mm - 432 mm (12x) zoom lens;
camera.summary: The Easyshare Z8612 IS offers a 12X optically stabilized zoom, a fair degree of manual control and an 8.1 megapixel sensor all wrapped up in a fairly compact body at a very attractive price point. The design is a bit 'love it or hate it', but for a budget model it's surprisingly well put together, handling is pretty good and the user interface is actually very nice. Unfortunately image quality problems and sluggish performance mean that it's hard to give it an unreserved recommendation.

camera.name: Kodak EasyShare C813
camera.description: 8.2 million effective pixels; 33 MP/cm^2 pixel density; 36 mm - 108 mm (3x) zoom lens;
camera.summary: One of a handful of almost identical budget cameras from Kodak (this one has 8.2 megapixels, a 3x zoom and a low-resolution 2.4" screen). As with all EasyShare models the emphasis is on user-friendly ease of use, and digital cameras don't some much simpler than this. The specification is as basic as you'd expect for such a low price and though we've not tested this particular model, our experience of this range is that in good light the results are fine, but don't expect much shooting at night or with flash. (April 2009)
